alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 21 at 5:10PM PST until February 21 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Stevens County in northeastern Washington... * Until 600 PM PST. * At 509 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Colville to 20 miles southwest of Chewelah, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 197 and 244. Locations impacted include... Colville, Chewelah, Kettle Falls, Marcus, Addy, Fruitland, Cedonia, Gifford, Orin, Arden, Valley, Hunters and Rice. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
